title: Most of Dallas-Fort Worth under tornado watch
text:

Updated at 4:15 p.m.: Revised to include tornado watch. 
Severe weather is expected to bear down on North Texas on Sunday evening, bringing threats of large hail and damaging winds. 
Isolated storms are expected to form northwest of Dallas-Fort Worth between 4 and 6 p.m. and will move east between 7 p.m. and midnight, said meteorologist Matt Stalley with the National Weather Service. 
"It's probably going to be one of those cases where you get a really strong storm and heavy rain and some severe weather or nothing at all," Stalley said. 
The highest chances for storms will be farther north toward the Red River around Gainesville, Sherman, Denton and McKinney, but there is a chance that a storm or two could develop in Dallas-Fort Worth, he said. 
With the severe storm threat comes the potential for golf ball- or baseball-size hail and strong or damaging winds. There is also a chance for a tornado, but that may stay closer to the Red River, Stalley said. 
A tornado watch was issued through 11 p.m. for parts of North Texas, including Dallas, Tarrant, Collin and Denton counties. A Tornado Watch is in effect for parts of North Texas through 11 PM tonight. #dfwwx #ctxwx #texomawx pic.twitter.com/k7Dwc5YJtZ â€” NWS Fort Worth (@NWSFortWorth) March 26, 2017 
If a storm stalls over one location, that area could get half an inch to an inch of rain. The storms are expected to move out of North Texas by midnight. 
Stalley encouraged people to keep checking weather alerts to make sure they're not caught up in a storm. Looking ahead 
As Dallas-Fort Worth enters a more active weather pattern, there are more chances for strong storms every few days, Stalley said. 
The next chance for storms could come late Tuesday or Wednesday, and possibly again next weekend. 
"Spring has really arrived for North Texas," Stalley said. 
Clouds are expected to start to form Tuesday and could bring a storm later in the day. There is a 60 percent to 100 percent chance of thunderstorms Wednesday. 
The weather Thursday could be partly cloudy, breezy and cooler, with a high around 74. Friday is expected to be mostly sunny and mild.
